comment._content: Hi, I'm starting a new group to celebrate the regional foods of Lincolnshire & I think your picture would be a fantastic addition."The Lincolnshire Food Pool"

comment.author: 8179033@N08
comment._content: I am a history buff whose main areas of interest are the Great Age of Sail (Patrick O'brian is a god), the Napoleonic Wars and the Seven Years War  (after all, most history is the history of conflict) ... it is photos such as this one that allow me to at least try to imagine what it must have been like to see a time when harbors were a forest of masts and spars. Sure it was an era in which life could be nasty, brutal and short, but it was also an age of real adventure and discovery.

comment.author: 29176961@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pentaxboi] What gets me pentax is that the woodwork looks as old and battered then as it did when i was a kid eeling down there!

comment.author: 36388413@N03
comment._content:
lol, I can imagine it does, egging a back o' doigs ;-)
(im hoping that means something to you! lol)

comment.author: 29176961@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pentaxboi] egging for me was collecting  birds eggs and i know exactly where doigs is, I used to catch flounders in there though it was muddy and snaggy! Not even sure you can get along there now, i used to bike round the back of the docks, through the woodyard and follow doigs creek up towards the west pier before bait digging on the north wall or fishing along the wall, east pier etc. happy, happy days.
